title: 'The Bachelor' star Peter Weber suffers 'freak accident' in Costa Rica, gets stitches
text:
CLOSE Mike Johnson broke his silence on ABC's choice as the next "Bachelor." Peter Weber was named the franchise's new leading man in September. USA TODAY

Peter Weber's journey to finding love on "The Bachelor" may include more than a few stitches.

According to E! and Us Weekly, Weber, who competed on the latest season of ABC's "The Bachelorette" before becoming the next "Bachelor," has suffered a fall in Costa Rica, injuring his face.

Weber is already back to work on set and filming a date, a person familiar with the situation but not authorized to speak publicly told USA TODAY.

"Bachelor" host Chris Harrison confirmed Weber "suffered a freak accident" and "got a cut on his head" in an Instagram post Tuesday.

"He did get stitches but he's 100% OK and production is already back underway," Harrison wrote, adding Weber is "still the dashing, handsome pilot we've all dreamed of."

USA TODAY has reached out to ABC for comment.

The 28-year-old Delta Airlines pilot finished as second runner-up on Season 15 of "The Bachelorette," despite becoming a fan favorite.

Weber gave his first post-show interview in July on the podcast "Bachelor Happy Hour," saying he recalled feeling "completely blindsided" after star Hannah Brown sent him home after their much-discussed windmill fantasy suite date.

More: 'Bachelorette' contestant Peter Weber talks heartbreak, windmills and 'The Bachelor'

Peter Weber, the latest star of "The Bachelor," reportedly injured himself in Costa Rica. (Photo: Noel Vasquez, Getty Images)

"I remember feeling so confident and secure right after," he said. "That day was amazing, the whole night, everything about our relationship I truly thought was on that next level and that was my person. So I remember going to that ceremony still feeling very confident. I had a little bit of nerves but was just feeling so good about it all."

More: 'I'm bored': Former 'Bachelorette' Rachel Lindsay weighs in on new 'Bachelor' Peter Weber

On the September finale of "Bachelor in Paradise," ABC revealed Weber would have a second shot at televised romance as "The Bachelor" on the show's upcoming 24th season.
